{{Infobox comics organization |image= ManiaksShowcase71.jpg |imagesize= 225 |caption=The Maniaks with [[Woody Allen]] from''Showcase'' #71,
artist [[Mike Sekowsky]] |publisher=[[DC Comics]] |debut=''[[Showcase (comics)|Showcase]]'' #68, (May 1967) |creators=[[E. Nelson Bridwell]] (writer)
[[Mike Sekowsky]] (artist) |type=Rock band |business=y |organisation= |organization= |base= |owners=Silver Shannon
Philip "Flip" Folger
Gilbert "Jangle" Jeffries
Bryon "Pack Rat" Williams |employees= |fullroster= |cat=rock musicians |subcat=DC Comics |sortkey=Maniaks }} '''The Maniaks''' are a [[fictional]] [[rock band]] published by [[DC Comics]]. They first appeared in issue ''[[Showcase (comics)|Showcase]]'' #68 (May 1967), and were created by [[E. Nelson Bridwell]] and [[Mike Sekowsky]]. ==History== The Maniaks were created in the mold of TV's [[the Monkees]]--a band that would also get involved in wild adventures, often on the way to their gigs. The band would meet fictionalized versions of famous celebrities, such as "Jeannette Punchinello" ([[Annette Funicello]]), "Rock Hutsut" ([[Rock Hudson]]), and "Twiggly" ([[Twiggy]]). An exception was comedian [[Woody Allen]], who appeared in an unfictionalized form in ''Showcase'' #71. ===Power Company=== {{main|Power Company}} The Maniaks as a band made no further appearances after ''Showcase'' #71. Silver Shannon later appeared in ''The Power Company'' limited series, where she worked as a personal assistant to [[Josiah Power]]. In ''[[The Power of Shazam|The Power of Shazam #48]]'', a one-issue revival that tied into the [[Blackest Night]] event, [[Osiris (comics)|Amon Tomaz]] makes a brief reference to the Maniaks. ==Membership== *'''Silver Shannon''' - lead vocals, manager *'''Philip "Flip" Folger''' - guitars, [[contortionist]] *'''Gilbert "Jangle" Jeffries''' - guitars, [[ventriloquist]] *'''Byron "Pack Rat" Williams''' - drums ==External links== *[http://www.comics-db.com/comic-book/1032005-The_Maniaks.html Showcase #68 in the Big Database of Comic Books] *[http://www.comics.org/details.lasso?id=20961 Showcase #68 at the Grand Comics Database] *[http://www.dcuguide.com/who.php?name=silvershannon DCU Guide: Silver Shannon] *Archive of [[Scott Shaw (artist)|Shaw, Scott]], [http://web.archive.org/web/20070525044110/www.oddballcomics.com/article.php?story=2007-05-21 "''Showcase''/The Maniaks No. 71"], "Oddball Comics" (column) #1157, May 21, 2007 {{DC-comics-stub}}
